citation.article-title: Caldisericum exile gen. nov., sp. nov., an anaerobic, thermophilic, filamentous bacterium of a novel bacterial phylum, Caldiserica phyl. nov., originally called the candidate phylum OP5, and description of Caldisericaceae fam. nov., Caldisericales ord. nov. and Caldisericia classis nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Caldisericum (Cal.di.se′ri.cum. L. adj. caldus hot; L. neut. n. sericum silk; N.L. neut. n. Caldisericum a silk existing in a hot environment).
Filamentous morphology with an outer envelope.
Growth occurs with anaerobic respiration using sulfur compounds.
Respiratory isoprenoid quinones are menaquinone-8(H6), menaquinone-8(H8) and menaquinone-8(H10).
The DNA G+C content of the type species is 34.6 mol%.
